main.name: Swapnanil Deb
main.description: Here will be your description. Use this to describe what you do or whatever you feel best describes yourself to a potential employer
main.bio: Use this bio section as your way of describing yourself and saying what you do, what technologies you like to use or feel most comfortable with, describing your personality, or whatever else you feel like throwing in.

resume.skillmessage: Here are some of the things I'm good at:

education.degree: Bachelors of Arts in Linguistics and Computer Science
education.description: Relevant Coursework: Data Structures, Systems, Intro to Artificial Intelligence, Natural Language Processing, Conversational Interfaces

education.school: Middlesex County Academy for Science, Math and Engineering Technologies
education.description: Majored in Electrical and Computer Engineering Technologies

work.title: Software Engineering Intern
work.description: Led project team to develop blockchain solution for airline transaction fulfillment company (2019);  Facilitated full stack blockchain training sessions for both public and corporate settings (2017-2018);  Led project team to handle client demands for a Fortune 500 agriculture client utilizing agile project management and contributed to project using Solidity, React.JS and the STRATO Ethereum VM (2016-2018);  Developed internal software for documentation, and continuous deployment using Swagger, MkDocs, and Jenkins (2016)

work.company: Northwestern University Prosody & Speech Dynamics Laboratory
work.title: Research Assistant
work.description: Designed and ran experiments to test effects of semantic predictability on speech accents (2018);  Utilized PsychoPy and Praat to detect trends in stress syllables across multiple subjects (2018-Present);  Developed Honors Thesis based on using pre-existing prosodic cues to form a maximally efficient training model for Tobi label detection (present)

work.title: Tech Team Committee Head
work.description: Developed React-Native application for both iPhone and Android to facilitate dissemination of concert and event information in real time to upwards of 5000 concert attendees for Northwesternâ€™s annual music festival, Dillo Day. (2018-2019); Led project team for maintenance and devlopment of dilloday.com, mayfestproductions.com and the Dillo Day Application using Agile project development processes. (2019-2020)

projects.title: Dillo Day
projects.category: The Official Dillo Day Music Festival Website

projects.title: Blockapps Developers Portal
projects.category: Developer Portal for Blockapps and STRATO

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
